reviewText:
The Emigrants
This film is a realistic portrayal of rural life in Sweden in 1844 and dreams of the peasants to emigrate to America. This movie portrays a hardscrabble life with hardship and tragedy in Sweden and the arduous journey to a new life in America. The viewer hears, feels, and sees close up what it is to work a farm by hand during this period and the details of the emigration to America. I am fascinated with this film. Its a true work of art.  Incredible cinematography with imaginative use of close upsiconic faces and images. Its poetry on celluloid and must see viewing.

Jon Troells Utvandrana - Efter en novell av Vilhelm Moberg

Utvandrarna tar oss till en fattig smlndsk by dr Karl Oskar och Kristina tar det svra beslutet att utvandra till Amerika. Tillsammans med grannar, vnner och barn ger de sig ivg p en ondlig resa mot ett oknt de i ett frmmande land. Mnga av dem fr utst hrda prvningar, en del nr aldrig fram, men de ger inte upp. De kmpar fr ett ml och en drm - drmmen om det nya, stora landet.

Vilhelm Mobergs gripande bcker om Karl Oskar och Kristina tillhr klassikerna inom den svenska litteraturen. Jan Troells filmatisering av dessa historier har blivit tv fantastiska filmberttelser. Utvandrarna r den frsta delen och fljs upp av Nybyggarna.

This is the first movie of the two-part saga "The Emigrants."

It's the original, Swedish version (not dubbed) version of the film by director Jan Troell.

Karl-Oskar and his wife Kristina make the decision to leave their farm in Sweden, and move to America.
